column4: Advanced Micro Devices must face securities fraud lawsuit-ruling

column4: German competition watchdog blocks Edeka's bid for Kaiser's
column5: DUESSELDORF  Germany  April 1 Germany's competition watchdog has decided to prohibit a plan by the country's biggest supermarket group Edeka to buy grocery chain Kaiser's  despite concessions it made  it said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-N.Y. lawyer charged for alleged role in scheme over Maxim magazine
column5: NEW YORK  April 1 A New York lawyer was charged on Wednesday over his alleged role in a scheme by a former United Parcel Service Inc executive's son to fraudulently obtain millions of dollars to finance the purchase of Maxim magazine.

column4: Chipmaker Micron forecast weakens  shares drop

column5: April 1 Chipmaker Micron Technology Inc  said on Wednesday on a conference call with analysts it expected fiscal third-quarter revenue of $3.8 billion to $4.05 billion.

column4: Chipmaker Micron's revenue rises marginally
column5: April 1 Micron Technology Inc reported a marginal rise in quarterly revenue  helped by higher demand for its chips used in personal computers  servers and smartphones.

column4: U.S. CFTC sues Kraft  Mondelez over alleged wheat price manipulation
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Wednesday charged Kraft Foods Group Inc and Mondelez International Inc with manipulation of prices of wheat used in products such as Oreo and Chips Ahoy cookies.

column4: Bill Gross of Janus says funds he manages resemble Bridgewater strategy
column5: NEW YORK Bill Gross  the closely watched bond investor  on Wednesday said the portfolios he manages at Janus Capital Group Inc closely resemble the investment strategies of Bridgewater Associates  the world's largest hedge fund firm.

column5: April 1 NuVasive Inc said Chief Executive Office Alex Lukianov resigned after an independent investigation showed he had not complied with the medical device maker's expense reimbursement and personnel policies.

column4: Sears Holdings to form REIT for some Sears  Kmart stores
column5: April 1 Sears Holdings Corp said it would form a real estate investment trust  which will buy about 254 Sears and Kmart stores in a transaction valued at more than $2.5 billion.

column5: Shares of Tesla Motors Inc.  jumped and trading volume surged in the final minutes of trading on Wednesday after the electric car maker issued a press release proclaiming the launch of a new product that turned out to be an April Fool's Day prank.

column4: N.Y. lawyer charged for alleged role in scheme over Maxim magazine
column5: NEW YORK A New York lawyer was charged on Wednesday over his alleged role in a scheme by a former United Parcel Service Inc executive's son to fraudulently obtain millions of dollars to finance the purchase of Maxim magazine.

column4: N.Y. lawyer charged for alleged role in scheme over Maxim magazine
column5: NEW YORK A New York lawyer was charged on Wednesday over his alleged role in a scheme by a former United Parcel Service Inc executive's son to fraudulently obtain millions of dollars to finance the purchase of Maxim magazine.

column4: UPDATE 1-N.Y. lawyer charged for alleged role in scheme over Maxim magazine
column5: NEW YORK  April 1 A New York lawyer was charged on Wednesday over his alleged role in a scheme by a former United Parcel Service Inc executive's son to fraudulently obtain millions of dollars to finance the purchase of Maxim magazine.

column4: N.Y. lawyer charged for alleged role in scheme over Maxim magazine
column5: NEW YORK  April 1 A New York lawyer was arrested on Wednesday for his alleged role in a scheme by the son of a former United Parcel Service Inc executive to fraudulently obtain millions of dollars to finance the purchase of Maxim magazine  the lawyer's counsel said.

column4: Drugmaker Valeant completes $11 billion purchase of Salix
column5: Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  completed its $10.96 billion purchase of Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd   the acquisitive company said on Wednesday.

column4: REFILE-Drugmaker Valeant completes $11 billion purchase of Salix
column5: April 1 Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc completed its $10.96 billion purchase of Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd  the acquisitive company said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 4-Arkansas governor seeks fix of religion bill seen as targeting gays
column5: LITTLE ROCK  Ark.  April 1 Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson told lawmakers on Wednesday to revise a bill that rights activists and U.S. businesses said allowed discrimination against gays  and home-state corporate giant Wal-Mart Stores Inc  praised his action.

column4: Walmart commends Arkansas governor for reconsidering religion law
column5: Retail giant Wal-Mart Stores Inc. commended the Arkansas governor on Wednesday for reconsidering a religion law for which the company sought a veto after it drew national criticism for opening the door to discrimination against gays and lesbians.

column4: Walmart commends Arkansas governor for reconsidering religion law
column5: April 1 Retail giant Wal-Mart Stores Inc.  commended the Arkansas governor on Wednesday for reconsidering a religion law for which the company sought a veto after it drew national criticism for opening the door to discrimination against gays and lesbians.

column4: Wal-Mart says looking at suppliers to help lower costs
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is looking at how it sources its products in an effort to reduce prices  especially as commodity prices fall globally  the head of the its U.S. division said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Wal-Mart says looking at suppliers to help lower costs
column5: April 1 Wal-Mart Stores Inc is looking at how it sources its products in an effort to reduce prices  especially as commodity prices fall globally  the head of the its U.S. division said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Whiting CEO says can still grow at current oil prices
column5: DENVER  April 1 Whiting Petroleum Corp  North Dakota's largest oil producer  can remain profitable and increase production even at current crude prices  Chief Executive Jim Volker said on Wednesday.

column4: Whiting CEO says can still grow at current oil prices
column5: DENVER  April 1 Whiting Petroleum Corp  North Dakota's largest oil producer  can remain profitable and grow production even at current crude prices  CEO Jim Volker said on Tuesday.
